page.title: 12SEWSTERN VILLAGE II
page.content: The summer months see one of the local farmers having to employ casual labour to hand pick potatoes. This unusual feature in this mechanised age is caused by the land being to stoney. The village has seen a decline in the local shop, local postman, Chapel closing, no bus service too Melton. The latter affects the 11 - 17 year olds. Their schooling takes place in Melton so they are unable to go to visit their friends etc. Even in the 1960's it was felt for a time that the village was in decline with no young people settling down owing to lack of employment and properties, but in late 1970's and early 1980's we saw them return because saleable properties became available and the ownership of a car to commute. So a thriving lyoung community is springing up.
